016package de.cuioss.test.jsf.renderer;
017
018import static de.cuioss.tools.collect.CollectionLiterals.mutableList;
019import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertDoesNotThrow;
020
021import java.util.ArrayList;
022import java.util.Arrays;
023import java.util.Collection;
024import java.util.HashSet;
025import java.util.List;
026import java.util.Optional;
027import java.util.Set;
028
029import javax.faces.component.UIComponent;
030import javax.faces.component.UIViewRoot;
031import javax.faces.component.html.HtmlForm;
032import javax.faces.event.FacesEvent;
033import javax.faces.event.PostAddToViewEvent;
034import javax.faces.render.Renderer;
035
036import org.junit.jupiter.api.BeforeEach;
037import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;
038
039import de.cuioss.test.jsf.config.renderer.VerifyComponentRendererConfig;
040import de.cuioss.test.jsf.config.renderer.VetoRenderAttributeAssert;
041import de.cuioss.test.jsf.renderer.util.DomUtils;
042import de.cuioss.tools.reflect.FieldWrapper;
043import de.cuioss.tools.reflect.MoreReflection;
044import lombok.Getter;
045
046/**
047 * While {@link AbstractRendererTestBase} focuses on API-Contract utility
048 * methods, this class provides a number of implicit tests. Simplifying the
049 * testing of concrete renderer behavior.
050 * <h3>Configuration</h3> You can configure this test by
051 * <ul>
052 * <li>{@link VerifyComponentRendererConfig}</li>
053 * <li>{@link VetoRenderAttributeAssert}</li>
054 * </ul>
055 *
056 * @author Oliver Wolff
057 * @param <R> The renderer being tested
058 */
059public abstract class AbstractComponentRendererTest<R extends Renderer> extends AbstractRendererTestBase<R> {
060
061    @Getter
062    private Set<RendererAttributeAssert> activeAsserts;
063
064    @Getter
065    private boolean wrapComponentInForm = false;
066
067    /**
068     * Initializes the active {@link RendererAttributeAssert} and checks for the
069     * {@link VerifyComponentRendererConfig} annotation
070     */
071    @BeforeEach
072    public void initAbstractComponentRendererTest() {
073        handleRenderAttributeAsserts();
074        handleConfigAnnotation();
075    }
076
077    private void handleConfigAnnotation() {
078        Optional<VerifyComponentRendererConfig> configOption = MoreReflection.extractAnnotation(getClass(),
079                VerifyComponentRendererConfig.class);
080        configOption.ifPresent(verifyComponentRendererConfig -> wrapComponentInForm = verifyComponentRendererConfig
081                .wrapComponentInForm());
082    }
083
084    private void handleRenderAttributeAsserts() {
085        activeAsserts = new HashSet<>(Arrays.asList(CommonRendererAsserts.values()));
086        final Set<CommonRendererAsserts> vetoes = new HashSet<>();
087        MoreReflection.extractAllAnnotations(this.getClass(), VetoRenderAttributeAssert.class)
088                .forEach(veto -> vetoes.addAll(mutableList(veto.value())));
089        activeAsserts.removeAll(vetoes);
090    }
091
092    /**
093     * Iterates through all active RendererAttributeAssert and tests them
094     * accordingly
095     */
096    @Test
097    public void shouldHandleRendererAttributeAsserts() {
098        for (RendererAttributeAssert attributeAssert : activeAsserts) {
099            var component = getWrappedComponent();
100            attributeAssert.applyAttribute(component);
101            component.processEvent(new PostAddToViewEvent(component));
102            var document = DomUtils.htmlStringToDocument(assertDoesNotThrow(() -> super.renderToString(component)));
103            attributeAssert.assertAttributeSet(document.getRootElement());
104        }
105    }
106
107    /**
108     * @return the {@link UIComponent} derived by {@link #getComponent()} or the
109     *         same wrapped in an {@link HtmlForm} in case
110     *         {@link #isWrapComponentInForm()} is {@code true}
111     */
112    protected UIComponent getWrappedComponent() {
113        var component = getComponent();
114        if (wrapComponentInForm) {
115            var form = new HtmlForm();
116            form.getChildren().add(component);
117        }
118        return component;
119    }
120
121    /**
122     * Helper method that extracts all queued events from {@link UIViewRoot}. In
123     * order to use this method the corresponding test must ensure, that the
124     * component under test is child of {@link UIViewRoot}. Otherwise the events can
125     * not be extracted
126     *
127     * @return the plain list of events available at {@link UIViewRoot} at this
128     *         time.
129     */
130    // owolff: Sonar false-positive
131    @SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked" })
132    public List<FacesEvent> extractEventsFromViewRoot() {
133        final List<FacesEvent> found = new ArrayList<>();
134        final var uiViewRoot = getFacesContext().getViewRoot();
135        // Hacky: Private field of myfaces
136        var eventField = FieldWrapper.from(UIViewRoot.class, "_events");
137        if (eventField.isPresent()) {
138            var events = eventField.get().readValue(uiViewRoot);
139            events.ifPresent(o -> found.addAll((Collection<? extends FacesEvent>) o));
140            return found;
141        }
142        // Hacky: Private field of mojarra
143        eventField = FieldWrapper.from(UIViewRoot.class, "events");
144        if (eventField.isEmpty()) {
145            throw new AssertionError(
146                    "javax.faces.component.UIViewRoot provides neither the field 'events' nor '_events'");
147        }
148        var events = eventField.get().readValue(uiViewRoot);
149        if (events.isPresent()) {
150            var eventLists = (List<List<FacesEvent>>) events.get();
151            eventLists.forEach(found::addAll);
152        }
153        return found;
154
155    }
156
157}
